page.title: 19CHURCHES AND WORSHIP
page.content: Many places of worship heve been built in the New Town since 1945 to provide for the diverse needs of the new communities in the neighbourhoods. We found over 20 congregations. Pupils at {Southgate West School}were asked, and attended between them{St Mary's, Southgate,{Holy Trinity,}Tilgate,{St {John's,}town centre,{St Andrew's, Furnace Green,{St Peter's,}West Green (all C of E), two{Baptist}Churches,{SS {Francis/Anthony,}town centre (R.C.), and the{Mormon}church, Southgate. {Sikhs}go to Langley Green or Three Bridges.{Muslims}go to Broadfield. Congregations vary from 50-70 at St John's and St Peter's to 1000 at the R.C. church, though 1600 attend St John's at Christmas. Christian worship has a long history here as both{St {John's}and{St Margaret's}(Ifield) can be traced back to the{C13th.
